intro: Phyllobolus trichotomus, commonly known as the three-lobed leaf bug, is a species of plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive three-lobed leaves that are typically broad and heart-shaped. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
